    • Method Detail

      • registUser

        public java.lang.String registUser​(java.lang.String username,
                                   java.lang.String identification,
                                   int userKind)
        The function adds a new user to a list based on their user type and returns a message indicating the success of the operation.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user being registered.
        identification - It is a String variable that represents the identification of the user being registered. It could be a unique identifier such as an ID number or a username.
        userKind - an integer value representing the type of user to be registered. 1 represents a premium user and 2 represents a regular user.
        Returns:
        The method `registUser` returns a message indicating whether a Premium or Regular user has been added and at what date.

      • registBiblioProduct

        public java.lang.String registBiblioProduct​(java.lang.String productName,
                                            int bookPages,
                                            java.lang.String publicationDate,
                                            java.lang.String productPrice,
                                            int magCategory,
                                            int emPeriodicity)
        This Java function registers a new magazine product with specified attributes and adds it to a list of bibliographic products.
        Parameters:
        productName - A string representing the name of the bibliographic product (in this case, a magazine).
        bookPages - The number of pages in the book.
        publicationDate - A string representing the date of publication of the bibliographic product.
        productPrice - A string representing the price of the product.
        magCategory - an integer representing the category of the magazine product being registered.
        emPeriodicity - The frequency of publication for a magazine, represented as an integer value. 1 represents daily, 2 represents weekly, 3 represents monthly, and any other integer value represents annual.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message that confirms the registration of a bibliographic product and includes the unique ID of the product.

      • registBiblioProduct

        public java.lang.String registBiblioProduct​(java.lang.String productName,
                                            int bookPages,
                                            java.lang.String publicationDate,
                                            java.lang.String productPrice,
                                            int bookGenre)
        The function registers a book with its details and adds it to a list of bibliographic products.
        Parameters:
        productName - A string representing the name of the book being registered as a bibliographic product.
        bookPages - The number of pages in the book.
        publicationDate - A string representing the publication date of the book in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".
        productPrice - a String representing the price of the book.
        bookGenre - an integer representing the genre of the book. 1 represents science fiction, 2 represents fantasy, and any other integer represents a historic novel.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a message that confirms the registration of a book and includes its unique ID.

      • deleteProduct

        public java.lang.String deleteProduct​(java.lang.String productName)
        The function deletes a product from a list of bibliographic products and returns a message indicating whether the product was successfully removed or not.
        Parameters:
        productName - a String representing the name of the product that needs to be deleted from a list of bibliographic products.
        Returns:
        A message indicating whether the product was successfully removed or not.

      • modifyProductName

        public java.lang.String modifyProductName​(java.lang.String id,
                                          java.lang.String newName)
        This Java function modifies the name of a bibliographic product based on its unique ID and returns a message indicating whether the update was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        id - A String representing the unique identifier of a bibliographic product.
        newName - The new name that you want to set for a bibliographic product.
        Returns:
        A message indicating whether the product name has been updated or if the product has not been found.

      • modifyProductPages

        public java.lang.String modifyProductPages​(java.lang.String id,
                                           int newPages)
        This Java function modifies the number of pages of a bibliographic product with a given ID and returns a message indicating whether the update was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        id - A String representing the unique identifier of a bibliographic product.
        newPages - An integer representing the new number of pages for a book product.
        Returns:
        A message indicating whether the pages of a bibliographic product have been updated or if the product has not been found.

      • modifyProductPrice

        public java.lang.String modifyProductPrice​(java.lang.String id,
                                           java.lang.String newPrice)
        This function modifies the price of a bibliographic product with a given ID and returns a message indicating whether the product was found and the price was updated or not.
        Parameters:
        id - A String representing the unique identifier of a bibliographic product.
        newPrice - A String representing the new price of a bibliographic product.
        Returns:
        A message indicating whether the price of the product with the given ID has been updated or if the product has not been found.

      • searchProduct

        public BibliographicProduct searchProduct​(java.lang.String productName)
        This Java function searches for a bibliographic product by name and returns it if found.
        Parameters:
        productName - a String representing the name of a bibliographic product that needs to be searched for in a list of bibliographic products.
        Returns:
        The method `searchProduct` returns a `BibliographicProduct` object.

      • buyBook

        public java.lang.String buyBook​(java.lang.String userName,
                                java.lang.String bookName)
        The function allows a user to buy a book and updates the necessary information such as the number of copies sold and the purchase date.
        Parameters:
        userName - A String representing the username of the user who wants to buy a book.
        bookName - The name of the book that the user wants to buy.
        Returns:
        The method returns a String message that indicates whether the book was bought successfully or not, and includes information about the user, the book, the date of purchase, and the price. If the user or the book does not exist, it returns a message indicating that.

      • buyMagazine

        public java.lang.String buyMagazine​(java.lang.String userName,
                                    java.lang.String magazineName)
        The function buys a magazine for a user and returns a message indicating the success or failure of the transaction.
        Parameters:
        userName - The username of the user who wants to buy the magazine.
        magazineName - The name of the magazine that the user wants to buy.
        Returns:
        The method returns a String message that indicates whether the purchase of a magazine was successful or not, and includes information such as the user who made the purchase, the date and time of the purchase, and the price of the product. The message may also indicate if the user or the magazine does not exist.

      • displayBooks

        public java.lang.String displayBooks()
        This Java function displays a list of books from a collection of bibliographic products.
        Returns:
        The method `displayBooks` returns a string that contains the names of all the books in the `bibliographicProducts` list, along with a number assigned to each book as an option.

      • displayMagazines

        public java.lang.String displayMagazines()
        This Java function displays a list of magazines from a collection of bibliographic products.
        Returns:
        The method `displayMagazines` returns a string that contains the names of all the magazines in the `bibliographicProducts` list.

      • testCase

        public void testCase()
        The function creates instances of a book, magazine, regular user, and premium user and adds them to their respective lists.

      • returnProductName

        public java.lang.String returnProductName​(java.lang.String id)
        This Java function returns the name of a product based on its unique ID from a list of bibliographic products.
        Parameters:
        id - a String representing the unique ID of a bibliographic product.
        Returns:
        The method `returnProductName` returns a `String` variable `name`, which represents the name of a bibliographic product with a unique ID that matches the input parameter `id`.

      • returnBookPages

        public int returnBookPages​(java.lang.String id)
        This Java function returns the number of pages of a book with a given unique ID from a list of bibliographic products.
        Parameters:
        id - a String representing the unique ID of a bibliographic product (e.g. a book) in a list called "bibliographicProducts".
        Returns:
        The method `returnBookPages` returns an integer value representing the number of pages of a book with the given unique ID.
